task_summary: The robot arm must pick up the tube from the tabletop. It seeks, reaches, aligns, grasps, confirms possession, and then retreats with the tube.

task_long_description.overview: A blue 7-DOF robot arm in a kitchen-like space interacts with a small white tube resting on a shelf. The arm first visually locates the tube, then prepares its gripper, approaches and aligns above the tube, computes a grasp pose, executes the grasp, verifies the object is held, and retreats with the tube. Key constraints: avoid colliding with shelf or other objects. The robot must react to failures in perception or grasp.
preconditions: Tube is placed visibly atop the shelf.
Robot arm is at a safe starting pose.
Workspace is clear of major obstacles.
stepwise_plan: Check if the tube is visible or detect it.
Move above the tube with an offset.
Grasp the tube at computed pose.
success_criteria: Tube is cleanly lifted from shelf by the robot.
Robot retreats with tube in gripper.
failure_and_recovery: Perception failure: Fallback detects the object.
Failed grasp: Robot can retry or alert operator.
Tube not in gripper: Sequence halts for intervention.
task_long_description.termination: Tree terminates after retreating with tube in gripper.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the tube is immediately visible to the perception system.
Actively search and detect the tube within a time limit.
Opens the gripper to an appropriate width for grasping.
Moves the robot end-effector to a pose above the tube.
Precisely approaches and aligns over the tube.
Computes a suitable top grasp pose for the tube.
Executes the actual grasp maneuver at the computed pose.
Checks if the tube is successfully held.
Safely retreats from the pickup location with the tube.

failure_modes: Tube not detected due to occlusion or perception error.
recovery_strategy: Sequence halts on failure to grasp; operator/automated retry.
Actions are time-bounded to avoid stalling.
No explicit retry for grasp; possible to wrap in higher-level Retry.
assumptions: The small white cylindrical object on the shelf is the 'tube'.
Instruction and visual task align (pick the tube is visually evidenced).
Top grasp is feasible given layout.
No specific force or speed constraints were specifiedâ€”defaults used.

expected_success_criteria: Gripper is holding the tube at end of sequence.
Tube is removed cleanly from the shelf.
